Paul<S>3972</S>, a servant<S>1401</S> of God<S>2316</S>, and<S>1161</S> an apostle<S>652</S> of Jesus<S>2424</S> Christ<S>5547</S>, according to<S>2596</S> the faith<S>4102</S> of God's<S>2316</S> elect<S>1588</S>, and<S>2532</S> the acknowledging<S>1922</S> of the truth<S>225</S> which<S>3588</S> is after<S>2596</S> godliness<S>2150</S>;
In<S>1909</S> hope<S>1680</S> of eternal<S>166</S> life<S>2222</S>, which<S>3739</S> God<S>2316</S>, that cannot lie<S>893</S>, promised<S>1861</S> before<S>4253</S> the world<S>166</S> began<S>5550</S>; <sup>In: or, For</sup>
But<S>1161</S> hath<S>5319</S> in due<S>2398</S> times<S>2540</S> manifested<S>5319</S> his<S>846</S> word<S>3056</S> through<S>1722</S> preaching<S>2782</S>, which<S>3739</S> is committed<S>4100</S> unto me<S>1473</S> according to<S>2596</S> the commandment<S>2003</S> of God<S>2316</S> our<S>2257</S> Saviour<S>4990</S>;
To Titus<S>5103</S>, mine own<S>1103</S> son<S>5043</S> after<S>2596</S> the common<S>2839</S> faith<S>4102</S>: Grace<S>5485</S>, mercy<S>1656</S>, and peace<S>1515</S>, from<S>575</S> God<S>2316</S> the Father<S>3962</S> and<S>2532</S> the Lord<S>2962</S> Jesus<S>2424</S> Christ<S>5547</S> our<S>2257</S> Saviour<S>4990</S>.
For this<S>5127</S> cause<S>5484</S> left I<S>2641</S> thee<S>4571</S> in<S>1722</S> Crete<S>2914</S>, that<S>2443</S> thou shouldest set in order<S>1930</S> the things that are wanting<S>3007</S>, and<S>2532</S> ordain<S>2525</S> elders<S>4245</S> in every<S>2596</S> city<S>4172</S>, as<S>5613</S> I<S>1473</S> had appointed<S>1299</S> thee<S>4671</S>: <sup>wanting: or, left undone</sup>
If any<S>1536</S> be<S>2076</S> blameless<S>410</S>, the husband<S>435</S> of one<S>3391</S> wife<S>1135</S>, having<S>2192</S> faithful<S>4103</S> children<S>5043</S> not<S>3361</S> accused<S>1722</S> <S>2724</S> of riot<S>810</S> or<S>2228</S> unruly<S>506</S>.
For<S>1063</S> a bishop<S>1985</S> must<S>1163</S> be<S>1511</S> blameless<S>410</S>, as<S>5613</S> the steward<S>3623</S> of God<S>2316</S>; not<S>3361</S> selfwilled<S>829</S>, not<S>3361</S> soon angry<S>3711</S>, not<S>3361</S> given to wine<S>3943</S>, no<S>3361</S> striker<S>4131</S>, not<S>3361</S> given to filthy lucre<S>146</S>;
But<S>235</S> a lover of hospitality<S>5382</S>, a lover of good men<S>5358</S>, sober<S>4998</S>, just<S>1342</S>, holy<S>3741</S>, temperate<S>1468</S>; <sup>men: or, things</sup>
Holding fast<S>472</S> the faithful<S>4103</S> word<S>3056</S> as<S>2596</S> he hath been taught<S>1322</S>, that<S>2443</S> he may be<S>5600</S> able<S>1415</S> by<S>1722</S> sound<S>5198</S> doctrine<S>1319</S> both<S>2532</S> to exhort<S>3870</S> and<S>2532</S> to convince<S>1651</S> the gainsayers<S>483</S>. <sup>as: or, in teaching</sup>
For<S>1063</S> there are<S>1526</S> many<S>4183</S> unruly<S>506</S> and<S>2532</S> vain talkers<S>3151</S> and<S>2532</S> deceivers<S>5423</S>, specially<S>3122</S> they of<S>1537</S> the circumcision<S>4061</S>:
Whose<S>3739</S> mouths<S>1993</S> must<S>1163</S> be stopped<S>1993</S>, who<S>3748</S> subvert<S>396</S> whole<S>3650</S> houses<S>3624</S>, teaching<S>1321</S> things which<S>3739</S> they ought<S>1163</S> not<S>3361</S>, for<S>5484</S> filthy<S>150</S> lucre's<S>2771</S> sake<S>5484</S>.
One<S>5100</S> of<S>1537</S> themselves<S>846</S>, even a prophet<S>4396</S> of their<S>846</S> own<S>2398</S>, said<S>2036</S>, The Cretians<S>2912</S> are alway<S>104</S> liars<S>5583</S>, evil<S>2556</S> beasts<S>2342</S>, slow<S>692</S> bellies<S>1064</S>.
This<S>3778</S> witness<S>3141</S> is<S>2076</S> true<S>227</S>. Wherefore<S>1223</S> <S>3739</S> <S>156</S> rebuke<S>1651</S> them<S>846</S> sharply<S>664</S>, that<S>2443</S> they may be sound<S>5198</S> in<S>1722</S> the faith<S>4102</S>;
Not<S>3361</S> giving heed<S>4337</S> to Jewish<S>2451</S> fables<S>3454</S>, and<S>2532</S> commandments<S>1785</S> of men<S>444</S>, that turn from<S>654</S> the truth<S>225</S>.
Unto the pure<S>2513</S> all things<S>3956</S> are pure<S>3303</S> <S>2513</S>: but<S>1161</S> unto them that are defiled<S>3392</S> and<S>2532</S> unbelieving<S>571</S> is nothing<S>3762</S> pure<S>2513</S>; but<S>235</S> even<S>2532</S> their<S>846</S> mind<S>3563</S> and<S>2532</S> conscience<S>4893</S> is defiled<S>3392</S>.
They profess<S>3670</S> that they know<S>1492</S> God<S>2316</S>; but<S>1161</S> in works<S>2041</S> they deny<S>720</S> him, being<S>5607</S> abominable<S>947</S>, and<S>2532</S> disobedient<S>545</S>, and<S>2532</S> unto<S>4314</S> every<S>3956</S> good<S>18</S> work<S>2041</S> reprobate<S>96</S>. <sup>reprobate: or, void of judgment</sup>
